intro: Mercurialis annua var. capillacea, commonly known as the slender mercury plant, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are arranged in clusters, and its leaves are narrow and often hairy. It thrives in disturbed soils and can be found in fields, roadsides, and wastelands. The species is part of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many plants with milky sap.
